intro: Withania novofriburgensis, commonly known as the Fribourgh wolfberry, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
